div1.p: IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF THE UNLAWFUL DETENTION OF 76 HINDOO ALIENS.
FILED IN THE U.S. DISTRICT COURT, Western Dist. of Washington, NORTHERN DIVISION OCT 30 1913
HERBERT W. MEYERS ATTORNEY AT LAW 430-431-432-433 PIONEER BUILDING PHONE MAIN 1278 SEATTLE, WASH.
MERCHANTS PRINTING CO., TIMES BLDG., SEATTLE
IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF THE UNLAWFUL DETENTION OF SEVENTY-SIX HINDOO ALIENS. ) ) ) ORDER TO SHOW CAUSE.

Moola Singh, Talok Singh, Dalip Singh, Bhagwan Singh, Pala Singh, Ala Singh, Biahsn Singh, Rulia Singh, Kishan Singh, Harijan Singh, Arjan Singh, Hire Singh, Bhag Singh, Amarao Singh, Duvan Singh, Puran Singh, Nuarang Singh, Dalip Singh, Vir Singh, Ratan Singh, Nama Singh, Bishan Singh, Bishan Singh, Rem Singh, Baboo Singh, Bhagat Singh, Thakar Singh, Variam Singh, Harnam Singh, Gurdit Singh, Kishan Singh, Gurbakhoh Singh, Khazan Singh, Paren Singh, Milkha Singh, Narnam Singh, Munshi Singh, Varian Singh, Sham Singh, Kakoo Singh, Basant Singh, Pooran Singh, Sher Singh, Santa Singh, Harnam Singh, Munshi Singh, Parem Singh, Partap Singh, Naurang Singh, Farzona Ali, Ahas Ali, Bahadar Shah, Mir Ahdylla, Nizam Din, Sultan Ali, Bagh Ali, Niaz Mohd, Rahmat Alla, Nayat Kahn, Amir Rhan, Amir Khan, Mohd Alam, Isay Khan, Amarat Khan, Sanday Khan, Shali Khar Khan, Namdar Khan, Gulam Modh, Sanday Khan, Baggn Khan, Umar Den, Ali But, Hanz Mohd, Chiragh Din, Madda Din, Ibrahim Din, Ismail Din, Rahmat Ali, Noor Khan, and Ishar Singh;

you and each of you are hereby advised that on this 20th day of August, 1913, a petition for a Writ of Habeas Corpus and Show cause order was duly filed, said
petition alleging certain irregularities and failures to comply with law in the matter of the deportation of certain Hindoo aliens and the court being satisfied that this is a case in which a show cause order should be issued,

YOU AND EACH OF YOU ARE HEREBY COMMANDED, to appear on the 26th day of August, 1913, at 10 A.M. in the United States District Court for the Western District of Washington, at Seattle, and then and there to show cause why a Writ of Habeas Corpus should not be granted and why you should not be enjoined and restraind from deporting the seventy-six Hindoo aliens whose names appear above, and be it further provided,

That you and each of you are commanded to keep the said seventy-six Hindoo alien petitioners in your charge or as many as may be deported in the city of Seattle, State of Washington, and not to deport or to make any effort to deport said aliens until the matter has been ruled upon by this court.
DONE IN OPEN COURT this 20th day of August, 1913. Jeremiah Neterer Judge.
